hi and welcome you listening to the X we

as we know the government companies they

cars when we look at new cars and we
start to look at the entire thing we
start to realize that things aren't
making sense and that's because things
are left out or the calculations have
changed now the Consumer Price Index for
used cars and trucks it shows that
there's been zero percent inflation
since 1994 in used cars and trucks
despite actual prices having soared so
yes the CPI for used vehicles in June as
reported by the Bureau of Labor
Statistics fell 0.7 percent from June a
year ago and is where it had been in
April of 1994 now let's think about this
for a second we've had zero percent
inflation since 94 how did they get
these numbers well it looks like they
used hedonic quality adjustment so the
question is what is this well in price
index methodology hedonic quality
adjustment has come to mean the practice
of decomposing an item into its
constituent characteristics obtaining
estimates of the value of the utility
derived from each characteristics and
using those value estimates to adjust
prices when the quality of good changes
so this is what the BLS is doing to
change the inflation calculations now of
course as we know car prices have been
moving up not down and just like with
every other item we've seen them move up
that's causing more and more to purchase
a car now what's also very interesting
about the automobile industry
used to calculate you know the
deliveries of the automobiles but now we

to fill that hole with estimates so now
they're estimating the deliveries of
these new vehicles now the new vehicle
market in terms of the number of

slightly stronger but now the market is
losing steam again as more and more

declining all at once and we haven't

of course what they're doing is they're

of like the subprime securities where
